page.title: 07Farming in Pawlett Hams.
page.content: Pawlett Hams is a flat area of farmland inside a "U" bend of the River Parrett.The land is crisscrossed by{rhines}which are man made ditches to carry away water.The{rhines}divide the land into fields which used to be flooded by the high tidal flows of the river. A protective bank has been made to ensure the farmland is not flooded. Since then the land is gradually being more intensively farmed.A typical farm has 110 milking cows and provides 1800 litres of milk per day(a milking cow is worth Â£500).The fields in the area are populated with mostly cattle and some sheep.As the land improves cereal crops like corn,oil seed rape,fodder beet and potatoes are being sown.{ {Mr.R.Thompson}a land owner everyday walks the 1000 acre area to count and check the animals in each field.
